discussion.content:
multiplier could be also configured on bfd for ipsec tunnels
https://sdwan-docs.cisco.com/Product_Documentation/vManage_Help/Release_18.4/Configuration/Templates/BFD#Configure_BFD_for_Application-Aware_Routing

bfd for aar = pool interval and multiplier
bfd for ip sec tunnels = color, hello, pmtu discovery
https://sdwan-docs.cisco.com/Product_Documentation/vManage_Help/Release_18.4/Configuration/Templates/BFD#Configure_BFD_for_Application-Aware_Routing

Technically, if a site is dedicated for services, then it can be spoke WAN Edge as well. But i can say that Answer is C thinking of hub and spoke architecture and spokes can't communicate with each other.

Selected Answer: C
C is the corrdect one.

Service route should be configured on the site belongs to services.
If HUB site include FW, the service route will be configured on Hub Edge.

questions.question_text: Which device should be configured with the service chain IP address to route intersite traffic through a firewall?

discussion.content:
A & D are not correct answer
* You can configure up to 512 interfaces on a Cisco IOS XE Catalyst SD-WAN device. This number includes physical interfaces, loopback interfaces, and subinterfaces.
* On a Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Controller or Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Controller NMS, you can configure one tunnel interface.
* On a Cisco IOS XE Catalyst SD-WAN device, you can configure up to eight tunnel interfaces.

On a Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Controller or Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Controller NMS, you can configure one tunnel interface. On a Cisco IOS XE Catalyst SD-WAN device, you can configure up to eight tunnel interfaces.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/system-interface/ios-xe-17/systems-interfaces-book-xe-sdwan/configure-interfaces.html
On vManage and vSmart you can have only one transport interface and on vEdge devices, you can have up to 7 transport interface.

Selected Answer: B
this is sentence from the link mentioned by Roger95
"On a Cisco vSmart Controller or Cisco vSmart Controller NMS, you can configure one tunnel interface. On a Cisco IOS XE SD-WAN device, you can configure up to eight tunnel interfaces."
so A - vSmart supports only 1 tunnel not 6
and D - vEdge supports up to 8 tunnels not 6
I would go for B in this case

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

comments.content:
for me is B, tunel 0 is not the tunnel interface. is the tunnel mode sdwan that's call physical interfaces related to tunnel interface.
Do in a cedge this command: show sdwan running-config sdwan
you will not see tunel0 on that part of the config for your example.

if you use show run: 

interface Tunnel2
 ip unnumbered GigabitEthernet0/0/0
 tunnel source GigabitEthernet0/0/0
 tunnel mode sdwan
!
interface Tunnel4
 ip unnumbered GigabitEthernet0/0/1
 tunnel source GigabitEthernet0/0/1
 tunnel mode sdwan

I hope it helps.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Ignore my previous comment.
A. up to 8 tunnels on vSmart
B. Feature template auto assign (G0/0/0 -> Tunel0)
C. Tunnel (sdwan mode) is for Transport VPN 0 only.
D. Correct. (doing test on lab)

Selected Answer: B
I go for B.

Maximum tunnels is 8.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/system-interface/vedge-20-x/systems-interfaces-book/configure-interfaces.html

questions.question_text: What is a restriction when configuring a tunnel interface?

choices.C: It must be configured for the interface under all VPNs.
choices.A: Up to six tunnel interfaces are configurable on a vSmart.
choices.B: It is manually assigned when using vManage feature templates.
choices.D: Up to six tunnel interfaces are configurable on a WAN Edge.

questions.question_text: An engineer must configure local redundancy on a site. Which configuration accomplishes the task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is indeed correct per sdwanlove

Correct answer is D. 

!
vpn 0
 !
 interface ge0/1
 ip address 10.50.2.1/30
 tunnel-interface
 encapsulation ipsec
 color mpls restrict
 allow-service all
 !
 no shutdown
 !
 interface ge0/5
 ip address 10.51.1.2/30
 tloc-extension ge0/1
 no shutdown

https://www.networkacademy.io/ccie-enterprise/sdwan/tloc-extension

Selected Answer: D
request vedge-cloud activate
Activate a vEdge Cloud router in the overlay network (on vEdge Cloud routers only). Before you can use this command, you must configure the organization name and the vBond orchestrator's IP address or DNS name on the vEdge Cloud router.
Command Hierarchy
request vedge-cloud activate chassis-number number token token

From <https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/command/sdwan-cr-book/operational-cmd.html#r_request_vedge_3137.xml>

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
https://www.itbase.tv/2023/05/04/cisco-sdwan-wan-edge-onboarding-options-explanation/

Given answer is correct --> D
